snippet: A growing number of investors are loading up on Greek government securities that mature in March - just when Athens is hoping to receive a lifeline of as much as €30 billion, or $38 billion, from the European Union and the International Monetary...
abstract: A growing number of investors are loading up on Greek government securities that mature in March - just when Athens is hoping to receive a lifeline of as much as €30 billion, or $38 billion, from the European Union and the International Monetary Fund, reports Landon Thomas Jr. for The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: A growing number of investors are loading up on Greek government securities that mature in March - just when Athens is hoping to receive a lifeline of as much as €30 billion, or $38 billion, from the European Union and the International Monetary Fund, reports Landon Thomas Jr. for The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: Hedge Funds Will Be Winners If Greek Bailout Arrives
